title: About
text: I’m the head of economic planning unit at Mexico’s Ministry of Finance. Have worked at the Institute of International Finance, IMF’s Western Hemisphere Department, the Inter-American Development Bank, and the Central Bank of Mexico. I hold a M.A. in economics from El Colegio de Mexico and a B.A. degree in economics from the UNAM. My research focuses on macroeconomics, with emphasis on public finances, sovereign debt, and commodity prices.

title: Time Series in R: Quick Reference
text:
These functions reads a file without a TS structure and then defines the TS object.

# Read from a raw csv file
raw.data <- read.table("./data/data.us.csv", sep = ",", header = T)

# When you have the dates in the original csv file
xts.data <- xts(raw.data, order.by = as.Date(raw.data$date, "%m/%d/%Y"))

# When you don't have the dates in the original csv file but know the starting date
date = seq(as.Date("1960/3/1"), by = "3 month", length.out = nrow(raw.data))
xts.data <- xts(raw.data[,-1], order.by = date, frequency = 3)

This function reads and declares the TS structure from the begining.

# Note that this is a TS with a zoo structure
ts.data <- read.zoo("./data/data.us.csv", index.column = 1, sep = ",", header = T, format = "%m/%d/%Y")
# Or...
ts.data <- ts(raw.data[,2:4], frequency = 4, start = c(1960,1))

# One can convert the TS-zoo into a xts...
xts.data <- as.xts(ts.data)





There are two main ways to get data into R: get the data into Excel or a csv or download for an online source. There are built-in package to get the data directly for the web in a predefined format. The table below shows the most popular sources and packages that one can use.

title: The Natural Interest Rate and the Taylor Rule Prescription
text:
The natural interest rate or r-star is commonly defied as the long-term interest rate such that monetary policy is consistent sustained maximum employment and inflation at its longer-run objective.1 Also it’s sometimes defined as the interest rate that would preveil in a steady state where prices are fully flexible and inflation is zero (Woodford, 2003). However, the approach that I will take here is the one put forward by Holston, Lauback and Williams (2017) which is more an equilibrium concept that uses a time series approach.
It’s imporant to note that this \(r_{t}^{*}\) variable is attached to slow-moving forces that hardly change except when there is a big disruption in the economy. As an example, these are the forces that can affect the natural interest rate:

Changes in labor productivity that affect the amount of labor supplied or the return on investment
Household’s desire to save or to realocate current consumption from the future
Public debt or government consumption that affect the use of aggregate savings in the economy
Capital flows, that is, the amount of financial resources coming from the rest of the world
The risk premia that the savers would like to received in return for their borrowed assets

title: Marcos Fiscales de Mediano Plazo
section: Marco de Política Fiscal de México
text:
Marco de Política Fiscal de México
Marco Presupuestal


Marco macroeconómico sin consejo fiscal (fórmula para precio del petróleo)
Tres reglas fiscales (meta de balance, techo de gasto estructural, trayectoria de deuda neta)
Techo de endeudamiento



Marco Normativo


Ley de Presupuesto (estabilidad fiscal, reglas y excepciones)
Ley de Ingresos y Deuda Pública (control anual sobre las fuentes de ingreso)
Presupuesto anual con aprobación del Congreso (distribución del gasto)




Marco Financiero


Fondo, seguros y bonos contra desastres naturales
Cobertura petroleras y otras variables financieras
Fondos de estabilización contra caída de ingresos

title: Marcos Fiscales de Mediano Plazo
text:
Marco Fiscal de Mediano Plazo
Elementos del MFMP


Proyección de 5 años basada en estabilizar el ratio de deuda-PIB
Se deriva de la regla fiscal de una trayectoria de deuda constante
No es vinculante y cada año se puede actualizar sin penalización
Amortiguadores financieros ayudan a cumplir presupuesto anual
El entorno global aumenta los errores de pronóstico y desviaciones de las metas fiscales

title: Marcos Fiscales de Mediano Plazo
text:
Marco Fiscal de Mediano Plazo
Principales Retos para profundizar el MFMP


Economía dependiente del exterior y de la renta petrolera
Espacio limitado para política monetaria y fiscal contracíclica
Proyectos sexenales y necesidad de consenso amplio sobre proyectos de mediano plazo

title: Marcos Fiscales de Mediano Plazo
text:
Como mejorar el MFMP
Marco Presupuestal


Reservar una partida de gasto para proyectos de largo plazo (e.g. infraestructura)
No aplicar a este gasto las reglas anuales
Excluir del techo de endeudamiento (financiamiento multianual)



Marco Legal


Ley de Infraestructura Pública
Ley de coordinación del gasto multianual con Entidades
Presupuesto multianual aprobado por el Congreso




Marco Financiero


Proyecto de financiamiento
Evaluación de impacto y pasivos contingentes
Reserva de efectivo, lineas de crédito y garantías
